data.name: SheetCell
desc: represents a single addressable cell in a spreadsheet document.
**since**
OOo 2.0

properties.name: AbsoluteName
desc: Returns the absolute address of the range as string, e.g.

properties.name: CellContentType
desc: contains the content type of the cell.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: ConditionalFormat
desc: contains the conditional formatting settings for this cell.
After a conditional format has been changed it has to be reinserted into the property set.

properties.name: ConditionalFormatLocal
desc: contains the conditional formatting settings for this cell, using localized formulas.
After a conditional format has been changed it has to be reinserted into the property set.

properties.name: FormulaLocal
desc: contains the formula string with localized function names.
This property can also be used to set a new localized formula.

properties.name: FormulaResultType
desc: contains the content type of the cell.
This property returns not com.sun.star.sheet.FormulaResult but instead com.sun.star.table.CellContentType. Use FormulaResult2 if the correct property is needed.

properties.name: FormulaResultType2
desc: contains the result type of a formula.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: Position
desc: contains the position of this cell in the sheet (in 1/100 mm).
This property contains the absolute position in the whole sheet, not the position in the visible area.

properties.name: Size
desc: contains the size of this cell (in 1/100 mm).

properties.name: Validation
desc: contains the data validation settings for this cell.
After the data validation settings have been changed the validation has to be reinserted into the property set.

properties.name: ValidationLocal
desc: contains the data validation settings for this cell, using localized formulas.
After the data validation settings have been changed the validation has to be reinserted into the property set.
